{"step_by_step_thinking": "The goal of administering analgesics is to manage and prevent pain. If we wait until the pain is moderate to severe or until after the anesthesia wears off, the patient will experience unnecessary discomfort. Administering analgesics prior to extraction might not be as effective because the anesthesia will also be in effect. Therefore, the best time to administer analgesics would be before the anesthesia wears off, so that the analgesics can start working before the patient begins to feel pain.", "answer_choice": "A"}
